cyclone.name: FRED
cyclone.current_location: about 235 miles south of Panama City, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Continues north-northwest across the east-central Gulf, then turns north to make landfall in the western Florida Panhandle before moving inland across Alabama and into western/central Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: western Florida Panhandle (near or east of Panama City to Navarre, FL)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch in effect from the Alabama/Florida border to Navarre, FL
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning from Navarre, FL eastward to the Wakulla/Jefferson County line; Storm Surge Warning Indian Pass to Yankeetown, FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Gulf Coast from Alabama through the Florida Big Bend, with inland impacts extending into southeast Alabama and western/northern Georgia
weather_observation.wind: Occasional gusts 25–35 mph possible Tuesday as the storm’s remnants pass west of the port; sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) remain unlikely (≤5%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along the Georgia coast; surge threat confined to Florida Panhandle/Big Bend
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could deliver 1–3 inches with localized higher totals Tuesday–early Wednesday, creating ponding on docks and low-lying terminal areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornado threat inland Georgia Tuesday; rough seas and elevated rip-current risk along the Georgia coast during mid-week
